TextBlock.Text: PHLOX: Ah, how quickly time passes! I cannot help but feel strange exploring my old dwelling as I undertake the quantum trial. See if you can figure out which chamber was my chamber of rest during the trial, friends!
DAZ: A boulder on the landing pad... I can't believe that worked! You're a genius, Cassava!
CASSAVA: Ah, imagine being patient enough to calculate shuttle trajectories to a location obscured by an atmosphere, Daz. Write on this wall if you were smart enough to think beyond the box, friends!
MALLOW: We finally made it up... Good luck on the trial, to those reading this. Goodness, I just want to get this over with.
AVENS: T-that second landing was stellar though, Mallow! Did you want to go first, or.. you know... We could undertake the trial together...
MALLOW: Sure, let's enter together. The instructions were to enter without friends, after all.

SPIRE: Oh, my. It seems those two lovebirds had a much rockier past than their present-day gooeyness would suggest. Do you have anything to write before you speed through this trial, my brilliant friend?

CONOY: Well, they still somehow got married before Mr Daz and Mr Cassava did.. And yes! I wish to see if I can apply the <color=orange>rule of quantum entanglement</color> anywhere in this trial! Always think beyond the box, my friends!
